intro: Dichromena elatior, commonly known as the greater dichromena, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that typically bloom in spring. The plant has slender, upright stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or streamside habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is more commonly encountered in the wild.
